course.subject: MAT
course.title: Calculus with Analytic Geometry I: Differentiation
course.catalogDescription: Includes the study of limits and continuity of real functions, the derivative of algebraic and trigonometric functions, and applications of the derivative. Not open to the student with credit in MAT 167.

prerequisiteDisjunction.prerequisiteGeneral: an ACT math subscore of at least 25

objectives.objective: Compute limits of algebraic and trigonometric functions.
Utilize the definition of derivative to derive or prove mathematical statements.
Find derivatives of algebraic and trigonometric functions.
Identify and use interpretations of the derivative to solve problems related to curve sketching, related rates, and optimization.
Utilize mathematical language and symbolism to communicate ideas and represent relationships.
Interact verbally with others to clarify and extend understanding of mathematical situations.
